item.title: METERON
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date November 01, 2011 End date January 31, 2020 Duration 3013 Discipline Technology Platform International Space Station Mars Exploration: METERON (Multi-Purpose End-To-End Robotic Operation Network) Facility Responsible Centre The overall goal of METERON is to set up a simulation environment to allow ground controllers in a Control Centre or astronauts on ISS to be able to simulate robotic exploration scenarios tele-operating a robot located on the ground through the ISS environment.

item.title: FSL - SMD (Soft matter dynamics)
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: The experiment container SMD is a class 2 payload which can be inserted in the FSL Laboratory. SMD allows to study foams, emulsions and granular matters in microgravity. The container provides optical microscope, single and multi specke diffusing wave spectroscopy, supporting also time resolved correlations, to investigate primarily dynamics on the surface of and inside opaque but translucent materials. The experiment container can be extended with on-orbit replaceable science cartridges.

item.title: CUBIST
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date January 01, 2010 End date December 31, 2013 Duration 1460 Discipline Knowledge management Platform International Space Station CUBIST was a research-project, funded by the European Commission, and conducted by several partners coming from different European Countries (Germany, France, the UK, Belgium and Bulgaria). CUBIST envisioned combining the two worlds of Business Intelligence and Semantic Technologies.

item.title: ODISSEA
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date November 01, 2002 End date November 17, 2002 Duration 16 Discipline Microgravity Platform International Space Station European Space Agency (ESA) astronaut Frank De Winne, of Belgian nationality, flew to the International Space Station (ISS) in late October 2002 on board a Russian Soyuz taxi flight. He became the first Belgian to visit the ISS.

item.title: CUBESAT network (QB50)
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date November 01, 2011 End date January 31, 2016 Duration 1552 Discipline Earth Observation Platform Cubesat QB50 had the scientific objective to study in situ the temporal and spatial variations of a number of key constituents and parameters in the lower thermosphere (90-320 km) with a network of about 40 double CubeSats, separated by a few hundred kilometers and carrying identical sensors.

item.title: PERICLES
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date January 01, 2013 End date March 31, 2017 Duration 1550 Discipline Knowledge management Platform International Space Station PERICLES did not want to invent another preservation system. It wanted to understand how to realize a world where preservation policies - human-defined, human-understandable policies- could shape and change a model of preservation that should, consequently, be implemented in a dynamic architecture with no reliance on any particular computational component.

item.title: Ulisse
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date January 01, 2010 End date December 31, 2012 Duration 1095 Discipline Knowledge management Platform International Space Station SUVIM was a Belgian Institute for Space Aeronomy (IASB-BIRA) network of stations measuring UV solar radiation with several instruments at each station. The network produced several UV radiation group at IASB-BIRA and provided UV indexes and solar irradiances at the stations in quasi-real time.

item.title: ALTIUS
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date December 31, 2016 End date December 31, 2020 Duration 1462 Discipline Earth Observation Platform micro-satellite of the PROBA class The ALTIUS instrument observing the earth upper atmospheric composition has been now included in the ESA earthwatch programme, B.USOC will operate an ALTIUS science centre in close cooperation with the BIRA-IASB team which initiated the project.

item.title: ASIM
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date April 13, 2018 End date January 31, 2020 Duration 658 Discipline Space Sciences Platform International Space Station ASIM Facility Responsible Centre ASIM is an ESA science instrument assembly to be flown on the Columbus External Platform Facility (CEPF) of the ISS (International Space Station). The ASIM concept has been proposed by DNSC (Danish National Space Centre, formerly DSRI (Danish Space Research Institute)), with the objective to observe TLEs (Transient Luminous Events) that occur in the Earth’s upper atmosphere accompanied by thunderstorms in the lower atmosphere.

item.title: FSL
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date October 01, 2013 End date January 31, 2020 Duration 2313 Discipline Microgravity Platform International Space Station The Fluid Science Laboratory is a multi-user facility to study the dynamics of fluids in the absence of gravity. The B.USOC is the control and command centre for FSL. It sends telecommands, receives telemetries and transfers the data to the scientists.

item.title: ASTROMAP
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date November 01, 2011 End date March 01, 2015 Duration 1216 Discipline Space Sciences Platform International Space Station A FP-7 project to support the European astrobiology network including a mandate to draft a roadmap for astrobiology which was used for the definition of the HORIZON 2020 programme. The programme began in early 2013 and organized 4 thematic road mapping workshops.

item.title: HAM VIDEO
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Informations Start date January 01, 2013 End date December 31, 2014 Duration 729 Discipline Technology Platform International Space Station The objective of the Ham Video On-Orbit Functional Commissioning was to install in Columbus and test the functionalities of the Ham Video hardware and the related on-orbit equipment. After successful performance of the above objective, the Ham Video Flight Segment could be declared functional and ready to be used by Amateur Radio on the International Space Station (ARISS).

item.title: PICARD
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date June 15, 2010 End date March 01, 2015 Duration 1720 Discipline Space Sciences Platform Myriade Picard was a microsatellite sending back data needed to improve models used for forecasting solar activity. It was designed to take simultaneous measurements of parameters such as the speed at which the Sun rotates, the radiation it emits, the presence of sunspots and its shape and diameter, to help scientists understand the relationship between them.

item.title: BRAMS
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date January 1, 2010 End date August 12,2016 Duration 2416 Discipline Space sciences Platform International Space Station BRAMS (Belgian RAdio Meteor Stations) was a radio set receiving stations using forward scattering techniques to study the meteoroids population. The project was coordinated by the Royal Belgian Institute for Space Aeronomy (BISA), within the framework of the Solar-Terrestrial Centre of Excellence (STCE).

item.title: KUPS
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date October 31, 2010 End date November 6, 2012 Duration 311 Discipline Space sciences Platform International Space Station The Portable Power Supply was an autonomous converter unit to distribute 28VDC to one or more payloads (up to three) taking the upstream power 120VDC provided by ISS Columbus Module SUP. KuPS was composed of a metal box containing all the required electronic parts and provided of interface connectors, on/off manual switches and autonomous cooling system (forced air convection).

item.title: LESS & EPO
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date August 29, 2009 End date December 1,2009 Duration 95 Discipline Space sciences Platform International Space Station EPO3 Water properties In the context of collaboration between ESA and UNICEF an overview lecture was given with demonstration of various water properties. The recording of the demonstration was used to produce ESA educational multimedia material for upper primary school teachers and their students aged 10-12.

item.title: Neurocog / Cardiocog
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date May 4, 2004 End date October 19,2004 Duration 168 Discipline Space sciences Platform International Space Station During the Increment 9 of the ISS utilization, two experiments with Belgian participation were hold in the Russian module: Neurocog (ULB, CNRS and CNES) and Cardiocog (KULeuven University and CNES). For both expeditions 9 crew members were taking part to these experiments, among them Russian cosmonaut Gennady I.

item.title: PromISS-4
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date December 21, 2005 End date April 1, 2006 Duration 101 Discipline Microgravity Platform International Space Station PromISS-4 was a Belgian experiment in the International Space Station (ISS) launched with the Progress 20P on 21rst December 2005. Its main scientific objectives were to study proteins, to obtain in microgravity better crystals, to understand protein crystal growth processes.

item.title: Taste in space
item.author: social_media@busoc.be (B.USOC)
item.description: Start date March 18, 2010 End date March 16,2011 Duration 364 Discipline Space sciences Platform International Space Station The activity was aiming to demonstrate to primary school students the differences in the way in which the sense of taste is affected under weightless conditions and on Earth by comparing the results of a blind tasting of 6 different food items on the ground and in space.
